wikipedia_page.main: Elizabeth Robson or Elizabeth Stephenson (25 June 1771 – 11 December 1843) was a British Quaker minister. She travelled to preach including almost four years in America where she visited over 1,000 meetings.

response: Doctrinal differences within the Quakers were created by the views of Elias Hicks of New York. Forster highlighted the issue in 1820. Prominent English evangelical Quakers which included Elizabeth Robson, Forster and Anna Braithwaite, decided to travel to the United States to denounce Hicks' views between 1821 and 1827.
|Anne Howells, Elizabeth Robson, Kenneth McDonald, Delme Bryn-Jones
|Gwyneth Jones, John Dobson, Elizabeth Robson, David Kelly

Doctrinal differences within the Quakers were created by the views of Elias Hicks after 1808; William Forster highlighted the issue in 1820, after the growth of Hicks’ influence. Prominent English evangelical Quakers, including Elizabeth Robson, Forster and Braithwaite, travelled to the United States between 1821 and 1827 to denounce Hicks' views.
